BASIC_CASE_INFORMATION.case_title: Kenya Power And Lighting Company Limited v Patrick Njane Mbugua another
BASIC_CASE_INFORMATION.subject_matter: Liability for a motor vehicle accident

COURT_INFORMATION.appellate_court: High Court of Kenya (Appellate Division), Milimani Law Courts, Nairobi

PARTIES.plaintiff_appellant: Kenya Power And Lighting Company Limited
PARTIES.defendant_respondent: Patrick Njane Mbugua (1st Respondent), William Macharia (2nd Respondent)

key_legal_issues: Ownership of the vehicle at the time of the accident
Presumption of ownership based on registration records
grounds_of_appeal: Errors in recognizing ownership and liability

OUTCOMES.relief_granted: Monetary compensation for damages at trial level

legal_principles_established: Presumption of ownership based on registration
LEGAL_PRINCIPLES.precedent_value: Reinforces the importance of registration records in ownership disputes
LEGAL_PRINCIPLES.case_law_cited: Selle v Associated Motor Boat Co. [1968] EA 123

procedural_history: Appeal filed as Civil Appeal No. 232 of 2016

key_evidence: Appellant: Testimony and documentary evidence of vehicle sale
Respondent: Testimony and medical evidence of injuries
